detaileddescription.para: keygen_once_128 Abstracts and cleans the key generation (expansion step) for AES-128 [1 step]

memberdef.name: keygen_three_192
memberdef.initializer: schedule[i] = temp1;\ schedule[i+1] = temp3;\ temp2 = _mm_aeskeygenassist_si128 (temp3, rcon1);\ aes_192_expAssist(&temp1, &temp2, &temp3);\ schedule[i+1] = (__m128i)_mm_shuffle_pd((__m128d)schedule[i+1], (__m128d)temp1,0);\ schedule[i+2] = (__m128i)_mm_shuffle_pd((__m128d)temp1, (__m128d)temp3, 1);\ temp2 = _mm_aeskeygenassist_si128 (temp3, rcon2);\ aes_192_expAssist(&temp1, &temp2, &temp3)

detaileddescription.para: keygen_three_192 Abstracts and cleans the key generation (expansion step) for AES-192 [three steps]

memberdef.name: keygen_twice_256
memberdef.initializer: temp2 = _mm_aeskeygenassist_si128 (temp3, rcon);\ aes_256_expAssist1(&temp1, &temp2);\ schedule[i] = temp1;\ aes_256_expAssist2(&temp1, &temp3);\ schedule[i+1] = temp3

detaileddescription.para: keygen_twice_256 Abstracts and cleans the key generation (expansion step) for AES-256 [2 steps]

briefdescription.para: Loads the key expansion based on the passed key and keymode.

detaileddescription.para: The key lenghts for the modes are as follows:

Possible values for the key mode and what it specifies:
aes_128:AES-128[key=128bits,AESrounds=10]
aes_192:AES-192[key=192bits,AESrounds=12]
aes_256:AES-256[key=256bits,AESrounds=14]

simplesect.para: The passed key does not need to be null terminated, no checks will be made to ensure proper length.

parameterdescription.para: A uint8_t array representing the key
The keymode that should be used, either AES-128, AES-192, or AES-256

simplesect.para: The key schedule for the requested AES keymode

briefdescription.para: Encrypts the data using AES implemented directly on the Intel Chip.

detaileddescription.para: Encrypts the data passed with the specified Key Schedule through AES using the key length set. The function is implemented using intel Intrinsics for greater performance.

simplesect.para: The encryption is done directly on the passed data array which must be 128 bits (16 bytes)

parameterdescription.para: The data to encrypt
The key schedule to use
The key mode specifying the key schedule length and AES mode

briefdescription.para: Decrypts the data using AES implemented directly on the Intel Chip.

detaileddescription.para: Decrypts the data passed with the specified Key Schedule through AES using the key length set. The function is implemented using intel Intrinsics for greater performance.

simplesect.para: The decryption is done directly on the passed data array which must be 128 bits (16 bytes)

parameterdescription.para: The data to decrypt
The key schedule to use
The key mode specifying the key schedule length and AES mode

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t *inpt, uint8_t *outt, uint8_t *ivec, unsigned long mlength, uint8_t *epoch_key, AESKeyMode keymode)
memberdef.name: aes_cbc_ni_enc

briefdescription.para: Encrypts the data using Cipher Block Chain (CBC) AES implemented directly on the Intel Chip.

detaileddescription.para: Encrypts the passed input data using CBC. The function is implemented using intel Intrinsics for greater performance.

CBC requires padding, which this function assumes you have already done
The input length must be a multiple of 16 (use padding if necessary) . No checks are run to ensure input, ivec, or epoch key are the correct lengths Possible values for the key mode and what it specifies:
aes_128:AES-128[key=128bits,AESrounds=10]
aes_192:AES-192[key=192bits,AESrounds=12]
aes_256:AES-256[key=256bits,AESrounds=14]

parameterdescription.para: The data to encrypt using AES and CBC
A pointer to a malloced location where the encrypted data will be written
The IV (Initial Vector) to be used for CBC
The length of the input message [in bytes] which is also the output (cipher) message length
The key (either defined by the user or generated by the software) that will be used for the key expansion to make the key schedule
The AES mode (also defines the key length and number of rounds) [see the possible values above]

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t *inpt, uint8_t *outt, uint8_t *ivec, unsigned long clength, uint8_t *epoch_key, AESKeyMode keymode)
memberdef.name: aes_cbc_ni_dec

briefdescription.para: Decrypts the data using Cipher Block Chain (CBC) AES implemented directly on the Intel Chip.

detaileddescription.para: Decrypts the passed input data using CBC. The function is implemented using intel Intrinsics for greater performance.

CBC requires padding, which this function assumes you will remove yourself after returning
The input length must be a multiple of 16. No checks are run to ensure input, ivec, or epoch key are the correct lengths Possible values for the key mode and what it specifies:
aes_128:AES-128[key=128bits,AESrounds=10]
aes_192:AES-192[key=192bits,AESrounds=12]
aes_256:AES-256[key=256bits,AESrounds=14]

parameterdescription.para: The data to decrypt using AES and CBC
A pointer to a malloced location where the decrypted data will be written
The IV (Initial Vector) to be used for CBC decryption
The length of the input cipher [in bytes] which is also the output (message) length
The key (passed by the user) that will be used for the key expansion to make the key schedule to decrypt
The AES mode (also defines the key length and number of rounds) [see the possible values above]

memberdef.argsstring: (uint8_t *inpt, uint8_t *outt, uint8_t *ivec, unsigned long mlength, uint8_t *epoch_key, AESKeyMode keymode)
memberdef.name: aes_ctr_ni

briefdescription.para: Encrypts or Decrypts the data using Counter Mode (CTR) AES implemented directly on the Intel Chip.

detaileddescription.para: Encrypts or Decrypts the passed input data using CTR. The function is implemented using intel Intrinsics for greater performance.

Due to the nature of CTR, encryption and decryption are the same so that does not have to be specified. If a non encrypted message is passed it will be encrypted, if an encrypted message is passed it will be decrypted
No checks are run to ensure input, ivec, or epoch key are the correct lengths Possible values for the key mode and what it specifies:
aes_128:AES-128[key=128bits,AESrounds=10]
aes_192:AES-192[key=192bits,AESrounds=12]
aes_256:AES-256[key=256bits,AESrounds=14]

parameterdescription.para: The data to decrypt/decrypt using AES and CBC
A pointer to a malloced location where the decrypted/encrypted data will be written
The IV (Initial Vector) to be used during the CTR process
The length of the input [in bytes] which is also the output length
The key (passed by the user) that will be used for the key expansion to make the key schedule to encrypt/decrypt
The AES mode (also defines the key length and number of rounds) [see the possible values above]

detaileddescription.para: The source file for the AES encryption (basic as well as CBC and CTR mode) implemented with Intel Intrinsics
